docker-host.name: Docker Host
docker-host.description: Store settings for interacting with a Docker host.
docker-host.code_example:
Get a Docker Host client.
```python
from prefect_docker import DockerHost

docker_host = DockerHost(
base_url="tcp://127.0.0.1:1234",
    max_pool_size=4
)
with docker_host.get_client() as client:
    ... # Use the client for Docker operations
```

fields.title: DockerHost
fields.description: Store settings for interacting with a Docker host.

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the API to use

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Default timeout for API calls, in seconds.

max_pool_size.title: Max Pool Size
max_pool_size.description: The maximum number of connections to save in the pool.

client_kwargs.title: Additional Configuration
client_kwargs.description: Additional keyword arguments to pass to `docker.from_env()` or `DockerClient`.

docker-registry-credentials.name: Docker Registry Credentials
docker-registry-credentials.description: Store credentials for interacting with a Docker Registry.
docker-registry-credentials.code_example:
Log into Docker Registry.
```python
from prefect_docker import DockerHost, DockerRegistryCredentials

docker_host = DockerHost()
docker_registry_credentials = DockerRegistryCredentials(
    username="my_username",
    password="my_password",
    registry_url="registry.hub.docker.com",
)
with docker_host.get_client() as client:
    docker_registry_credentials.login(client)
```

fields.title: DockerRegistryCredentials
fields.description: Store credentials for interacting with a Docker Registry.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to log into the registry with.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to log into the registry with.

registry_url.title: Registry Url
registry_url.description: The URL to the registry. Generally, "http" or "https" can be omitted.

reauth.title: Reauth
reauth.description: Whether or not to reauthenticate on each interaction.
